H0.text: Tilt of the Earth's axis is the major cause of seasonal changes.

H1.text: Earth changing its distance from the Sun is the major cause of seasonal changes.

H2.text: Changing patterns in wind and ocean currents are the major cause of seasonal changes.

H3.text: Cycles in the amount of energy released by the Sun are the major cause of seasonal changes.

A4.text: The seasons are not the result of the variation in Earth's distance to the Sun because of its elliptical orbit.

A5.text: The axial tilt of the Earth accounts for most of the seasonal variation in climate in both hemispheres.
